description: Aromas of pumpkin, squash and corn chips are stale and not inviting. There's an acceptable mouthfeel to this weird, unbalanced Chardonnay along with flavors of spiced squash, mealy apple and sautÃ©ed root vegetables.
title: ViÃ±a TarapacÃ¡ 2015 Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)

description: Aromas of strawberry sherbet are followed by sweet candy-shop flavors on the palate. Chill it thoroughly before drinking. Screwcap.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: Fluffy, sweet aromas of peach, pear and vanilla are as good as it gets. Tastes of powdered sugar and the most forced oak you can imagine. Not at all surprising that it's resiny on the finish.
title: Cuevas del Sur 2010 Reserve Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: There's a thorny, almost raw quality of fruit here that is backed by a touch of dill weed and black tar. It feels tart and slightly bitter on the close.
title: Fattoria Giuseppe Savini 2011 Rondineto Merlot (Colli Aprutini)

description: With dusty, candied aromas, the bouquet on this semisweet Cava is scattered all over the map. In the mouth, it's inoffensive, however the wine's candied, melony flavors are cloying and overtly sugary. This is too clumsy and candied to be taken seriously.
title: Paul Cheneau NV Demi Sec Sparkling (Cava)

description: Ashy, green and funky smelling, then sweet, chunky and murky tasting. Nothing is meshing here. It's barely acceptable.
title: Bodega Carmine Granata 2009 SÃ©millon (Mendoza)

description: A rough, pinchy nose with leather and funk is no way to begin. The palate stays hard and spiky, with burnt, rustic, murky flavors. Roasted and mossy on the finish, and not very good overall.
title: Cruz Alta 2007 Grand Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Heavily vegetal and unclean on the nose, then pickled on the palate, as in sauerkraut. The only thing saving this from the flusher is decent body weight and mouthfeel.
title: Ricardo Santos 2009 SÃ©millon (Mendoza)

description: Mute on the nose, but heavy in the mouth, with grapefruit and pickled flavors. Finishes pickled and pithy. Already old.
title: Gardel 2009 TorrontÃ©s (Mendoza)

description: Medicinal and feral on the nose, then heavy, thick and extremely creamy and soft in the mouth, with bland, flat flavors of milk, carob and vanilla. Short on fruit, acidity and purpose.
title: Alma del Sur 2009 ColecciÃ³n Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Mendoza)

description: The only thing that makes this a gran reserva is the label and the winery's commitment to a big, extracted, heavily oaked wine. It's black as ink but clumsy as can be. Smells and tastes like shoe polish, resin and oily fruit. Not what we're looking for from Argentina, or anywhere for that matter. Barely acceptable. Imported by Carolina Wine Brands USA.
title: Finca El Origen 2007 Gran Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

description: This is the first TorrontÃ©s from Pascual Toso that we've rated, and if it's any indication of what's going on there, then we say stick to the reds. This is a borderline dud, with chunky, hollow flavors and a mealy finish. Not a total mess but not a good, vivacious Argentine Torrontes by any stretch.
title: Pascual Toso 2007 TorrontÃ©s (MaipÃº)

description: Having liked the 2007 rosÃ© from Los Vascos, this pickled, citric burner just doesn't cut it. It shows Sauvignon Blanc-like flavors and acidity, while the finish is sour and briney. Devoid of the charm and pleasantries that rosÃ© should deliver.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2008 Los Vascos RosÃ© (Colchagua Valley)

description: Dry, dull papaya and apricot aromas surely don't overwhelm, but they don't foretell the complete lack of fruit on the palate. A faded, insipid white wine. It has no pulse and tastes mealy.
title: Eleusis 2006 AlbariÃ±o (RÃ­as Baixas)

description: Too sweet by far for a table wine, with simple, medicinal cherry and blackberry flavors and a harshly tannic mouthfeel.
title: Esser Cellars 2005 Zinfandel (California)

description: Excessively ripe fruit verging on baked, burnt blackberries, hard tannins and residual sweetness.
title: Vina Robles 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A white this age should be fresh and crisp; this one is a bit dull and shows only faint bitter lemon flavors on the finish to go with tired apple aromas.
title: Seigneurs de Bergerac 1999 White (Bergerac)

description: Picture grandma standing over a pot of stewed prunes, which fill the dusty old house with their sickly aromas. Cooked, earthy and rustic, this wine has little going for it. Just barely acceptable.
title: Mont Tauch 1998 Red (Fitou)

description: Just barely acceptable, this soft, semisweet Cab has Lifesaver candy flavors of cherries and raspberries.
title: Pianetta 2004 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)

description: Rubbery, animal-like aromas are low on fruit. The palate is shrill and dominated by sharp acidity. Sour, herbal and pinched tasting, this is tart and green overall.
title: Quintay 2013 Clava Reserve CarmenÃ¨re (Rapel Valley)

description: Yeasty, melony and smelling like yellow mustard, this Moscato is generally unappealing. Spritzy (but barely) on the palate, it has flavors of canned pineapple and mango, with a cloying finish.
title: flipflop NV Left Coast Moscato (Chile)

description: Strained and oily on the nose, this lacks freshness and fruitiness. Briny flavors are extreme and sweaty, while the finish tastes a lot like sauerkraut.
title: William Cole 2014 Albamar Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Sweet and sour, with cherry and raspberry jam flavors finished with acidity that stings the palate, like vinegar.
title: Sunstone 2007 Syrah RosÃ© (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Light, almost ephemeral, this pale Pinot does not give you much to hold on to. The fruit is thin to the point of invisible, tasting of watermelon and little else. Thin, watery and plain.
title: Del Rio 2007 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)

description: Rustic and simple, with sweetened cherry-berry and cola flavors that finish in a swirl of sugary blackberry jam.
designation: Wild Horse Peak Mountain Vineyards 4-Block Blend
title: South Coast 2005 Wild Horse Peak Mountain Vineyards 4-Block Blend Cabernet Sauvignon (South Coast)

description: Tastes like it has some volatility, with sharp, unpleasant acids framing flavors of cherries and raisins.
title: Longevity 2005 Merlot (Sierra Foothills)

description: Oxidized almost to the point of being tawny in the glass, this soft and buttery wine has virtually no fruit left, and finishes with a bitter edge.
title: NamastÃ© Vineyards 2006 Serenity Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Rustic and sweet, with a soft mouthfeel and candied cherry-berry flavors.
title: Finnegan's Lake 2007 Fin Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This RhÃ´ne-style blend is harsh and rugged, with unripe mintiness, but it has enough cherry, berry and mocha flavors to pass.
title: Chronic Cellars 2006 Sofa King Bueno Red (Paso Robles)

description: Sketchy right away, with salinic, pool water aromas. Awkward and buttery in the mouth, with corn and baked apple flavors. Finishes salty and nutty.
title: Lidio Carraro 2010 Da'divas Chardonnay (Vale dos Vinhedos)

description: Yellowish in color, a true indicator that this is on the way out. Tastes chunky and flat, with bland lychee and melon flavors. Short then bitter on   the finish.
title: Villa ViÃ±a 2006 TorrontÃ©s (Salta)

description: Best on the nose, but sharp and narrow as can be on the palate. Cranberry and sour cherry flavors dominate, while the finish is astringent. No amount of swirling and saving is going help it much.
title: Reula 2003 Oak Aged Tempranillo-Merlot (CariÃ±ena)

description: Trapiche's Broquel line has never featured Pinot Noir before, and maybe this is why. Talk about a sharp, scouring wine. It's lemony and lean, with piercing cranberry flavors and razor-sharp acidity. Crispness is one thing; sharp and edgy is another.
title: Trapiche 2006 Broquel Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: Smells baked and hot, tastes harsh and dry, a bitter, astringent wine without charm.
title: Pietra Santa 2004 Merlot (Cienega Valley)

description: Beware of funky labeled Malbecs because many don't have much to offer. Case in point, this candied, scratchy wine with wild, rampant fruit and not much else. Tastes like a jug wine.
title: Ku DÃ© Ta 2006 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Thin brambly aromas and wet rubber don't bode well for the mouth, which is thin, tart and dominated by pie cherries and apple skins. A long, starching finish sends it on its way without much charm.
title: Baroncini 1998 Le Mandorlae  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Bold and very clumsy. There are leathery elements to the nose and wild, grapy fruit that stumbles onto the palate. A wall of tannins hits you on the finish, and throughout it's untamed and overdone. Very fruity and forward, but devoid of tact.
title: ChÃ¢teau de Pennautier 2001 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Heavy and waxy, with overdone varietal aromas that seem oily. Lots of pepper and cumin, but what about the fruit and acidity? Nowhere to be found.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Vin de Pays de l'Ardeche Viognier (France)

description: A tartly acidic wine, with some sweet molasses aromas but also hints of decaying vegetation.
title: Willow Creek 2000 Pinot Noir (Canterbury)

description: In general O. Fournier gets it right, be it in Spain or Argentina. But this Ribera del Duero struggles from the outset. It's rubbery, damp and lacks clarity of fruit. And the feel is sharp and lemony, seemingly a combo of excessive oak and raw fruit. Imported by Fine Wines from Spain.
title: O. Fournier 2002 Spiga  (Ribera del Duero)

description: Simple and Porty, with baked berry flavors that finish sharp and astringent.
title: California's Jewel 2004 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Phebus is a new label from Fabre Montmayou, and frankly this wine has issues. It smells a lot like gumballs and a wet, dirty dog. It doesn't have much substance or flow, and that gamy, wet-dog character is persistent, even on the flavor profile.
title: Fabre Montmayou 2005 Phebus Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Vegetal and watery, a very dry wine that offers little in the way of fruit. Tastes like alcohol with a drop or two of grapefruit juice.
title: Pacific Oasis 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Fruits, flowers and spice should lead the nose and bathe the palate with this Nebbiolo, but the wine falls flat, with bitter, sweet flavors that are astringent in nature and lack elegance.
title: Hermes 2006 Estate Bottled Nebbiolo (Ohio)

description: A soft, medicinal and uninteresting wine, marked by harshness and green flavors that barely suggest cherries.
title: Buzzard Tree 2005 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Thin, dry and harsh, with cola flavors that are so thin, all you can really detect is the heat of alcohol. If you're not fussy, it's a basic introduction to Pinot Noir.
title: Congress Springs 2006 Pinot Noir (California)

description: A red RhÃ´ne blend that's too soft, hot and sweet. It has the taste of sugary raspberry jam and is not a dry table wine.
title: Four Vines 2005 The Peasant Red (Paso Robles)

description: Soft and awkward, with dull berry flavors that have a vegetal tinge.
title: Four Vines 2005 Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: A sweet, high-fueled blend of Chardonnay, Muscat Blanc and old-vine Trebbiano from a newly approved appellation called the Sierra Pelona Valley, north of Los Angeles, this wine has peach and lemon peel hiding behind a lathering of oak.
title: Reyes NV White Delight White (Sierra Pelona Valley)

description: Just barely drinkable. It's not dirty or anything, but watery and very fruity.
title: Inkling 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Reedy, herbaceous aromas suggest rhubarb and red licorice candy. This feels flat and lays heavily on the palate, while candied flavors of cherry and berry finish hot.
title: Fat Gaucho 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Gold in color, with a chunky palate and pushy, reduced, mealy flavors of grapefruit. Vegetal on the finish. Tasted twice with identical results.
title: Ventisquero 2012 Queulat Single Vineyard Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Watery and sweet, with apricot and orange jam flavors.
title: Kitchen Sink NV Chardonnay (California)

description: Soft, sweet and simple raspberry and oak flavors mark this rustic wine.
title: Pessimist 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Cherry cough drop aromas are candied and ominous. This feels diluted, tastes herbal and green, and finishes minty.
title: Arge & Tina 2011 Malbec (San Juan)

description: The color of castor oil, this sweet table wine offers clove and root beer flavors that cling to the finish.
title: Cooper Vineyards NV Noche Sweet Table Wine Red (Virginia)

description: Tropical, soapy aromas are yeasty and flat. Flavors of lychee and melon have no follow-through and finish mealy.
title: Tres Exilios 2013 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Candied plum and red berry aromas smell like red licorice. Flavors are raisiny, with sourness and astringency.
title: Terrenal 2013 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

description: There isn't much to love about this weedy abrasive high-acid Tempranillo. Green and grassy in flavor, with a minty acidic finish, this is barely cutting it as a whole.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Love 2015 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Chemicalized aromas of lemon peel and turpentine are offputting. This feels bland and tastes oxidized and bitter.
title: Finca Patagonia 2015 Expedicion Chardonnay (Maule Valley)

description: This red-colored barrel-fermented rosÃ© of Tempranillo and Merlot smells funky and gummy. Flat on the palate, this tastes of pickled red cabbage: charmless and difficult to get through.
title: Pradorey 2016 Tempranillo-Merlot Fermentado en Barrica Rosado (Ribera del Duero)

description: Muddled candied aromas smell uniquely unnatural and forced. This is choppy and jagged in the mouth, while a strange set of fake-oak and murky berry flavors are prominently on display.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Love 2015 Merlot (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This is mucky and sweet. Its best foot is not put forward via the compost-like nose, and from then on there's little more than prune, leather and a sticky mouthfeel.
title: Castillo de MonsÃ©ran 2006 Garnacha (CariÃ±ena)

description: Too powerful in feline and gooseberry aromas and flavors, this dry, tart in-your-face Sauvignon Blanc just isn't ripe enough to recommend.
title: Elizabeth Rose 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Greenwood Ridge often does a good job at Sauvignon Blanc, but not this year. The wine is irritating in unripe feline flavors and it's also off-dry, with 1.9% residual sugar.
title: Greenwood Ridge 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

description: This unoaked Sauvignon Blanc is really powerful in feline characteristics. Too powerful. Unless you like that peculiar smell and taste, it will turn you off.
title: Ironstone 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: There's something not right about the way this winery is fermenting its Cavas because both this and Oriol Rossell's regular brut are excessively foamy. As a result, this gran reserva's apple and spice aromas and flavors are rendered moot by the gaseous explosion that occurs when liquid hits palate.
title: Oriol Rossell NV Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Eight grapes comprise this weird, peanutty, almost dirty red blend. The nose is like a salad of bitter greens and peanut vinaigrette, and the palate shows big fruit, bigger tannins and then a finish of asparagus and green beans. Imported by USA Wines Inc.
title: Chozas Carrascal 2004 Las Ocho Red (Utiel-Requena)

description: Smells and tastes like caramel and stewed cherry and blackberry flavors that taste overtly sweet. However, this rustic blend of Syrah and Sangiovese may have its fans.
title: MillÃ©simÃ© 2005 Scoprire Red (California)

description: Port-like, with raisiny, baked cherry and caramel flavors. Finishes dry.
title: French Hill 2006 Grand Reserve Petit Verdot (California)

description: This diluted wine opens with aromas suggesting old cut flowers and wet soil. The thin watery palate has just a hint of unripe sour cherry.
title: Tenimenti Montagnana 2014 Rubentino  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: Funky, heavily pickled aromas lack clarity, charm and cleanliness. This feels flat as a board, with bitter sour nutty flavors of spoiled citrus fruits. A sour, murky finish fails to help it along.
title: Zudugarai 2015 Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)

description: Oddly tropical and floral, like an Argentine TorrontÃ©s. Spritzy in the mouth but weird tasting and funky, with cloying, unusual flavors that frankly don't taste very good.
title: Emiliana 2009 Natura GewÃ¼rztraminer (Rapel Valley)

description: Roasted, herbal and blunt, with an acrid stemminess. The palate lacks ripeness and elegance as it delivers burnt, leafy, herbal flavors. Underwhelming.
title: Vega Murillo 2008  Toro

description: A heavy, acidic and boring wine, not offering much in the way of flavor except for some bitter cherries.
title: Fenestra 2007 Silvaspoons Vineyards Touriga Nacional (Lodi)

description: Average peach and apple aromas are as good as it gets. The palate is wet, heavy, charmless and cidery, with aggressive apple and citrus flavors. And oak wouldn't likely help it.
title: La Playa 2009 Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

description: Neutral aromas, sour apple and citrus flavors, a spritzy mouthfeel and soda-like on the finish. Unsophisticated to a fault.
title: Quasar 2009 Chardonnay (CuricÃ³ Valley)

description: The aromas of this wine are gummy and candied on the nose. Weird flavors of pastry, mulched earth and clay are devoid of clean fruit and finish jumbled and flat.
title: AgustÃ­n Cubero 2013 Unus Old Vine Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Rusty in color, with rubbery cherry and raspberry aromas, this is a sticky, candied rosÃ© with a low freshness quotient. Candied, sugary flavors finish sweet and gooey.
title: Bocopa 2014 Alone RosÃ© (Alicante)

description: This wine is flawed, with rustic leathery undertones that veer into Band-Aid, and an intensely sour note. Multiple bottles tried over several months.
title: Peter Cellars 2011 Carneros Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This Merlot has not fully ripened, with aromas of bell pepper, green herbs and savory notes overriding any sense of variety. Flavors are faint and lighter in style, trailing on the finish.
title: James Wyatt 2013 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Barely drinkable, with sweet, sugary flavors and a few drops of citrus fruit.
title: Pessimist 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: Tropical, citrusy aromas are about as good as this gets. The palate is cloying and the flavors of banana and burnt sugar finish sticky.
title: Beach Kite 2012 Moscato (Central Valley)

description: Even at this price, this Cab is hard to like. It's soft and somewhat vegetal, with bizarre sweet oak and cherry jam flavors.
title: Coyote Creek 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Grassy, herbaceous, raisiny aromas are green and harsh. This is brutally tannic and out of whack on the palate, while green, weedy flavors finish thick, blocky and rough.
title: Antonio Gonzalez 2012 Galan Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This vivid pink-colored wine tastes of candy with added acidity. There is some sweetness along with the artificial flavors.
title: Bougrier 2015 Gamay-Grolleau  (RosÃ© d'Anjou)

description: Gritty aromas of asphalt, licorice and especially clove are off the beaten path. Flavors of dried clove, pepper and wood smoke are dominant and don't allow for any fruit to show through. A finish that tastes like pure clove is in its own zip code. Tasted twice.
title: Haarth 2013 Made With Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Argentina)

description: Not a good year for this wine, which is green and fuzzy on the tongue, a strange waft of chemical overpowering over all.
title: Tortoise Creek 2011 Schoolhouse CuvÃ©e Merlot (Clarksburg)

description: Vegetal and metallic on the nose, this Verdejo fails to improve as it goes along. It's dilute in feel, with celery and grassy flavors. It finishes bitter and flabby.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Gran Castillo Royal 2012 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: The wine shows a maderized color and aromas of oxidized stone fruits and rubber. This fast-fading rosÃ© feels flat, with mushy flavors of peach, melon and mushroom. Bitterness rises up on the finish.
title: SignoSeis 2012 The Angel Oak RosÃ© (Valle de Uco)

description: This wine has a burnt rubber, mouth-puckering and slightly chemical undertone in aroma and taste.
title: Barra of Mendocino 2011 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

description: Murky, stewy, soupy aromas deliver little to no freshness or fruit, while the palate is tannic and tastes bitter, mildly weedy and minty. Seems roasted and devoid of quality. Unclean and unimpressive.
title: Staphyle 2008 VÃ¡stago de Gea Cabernet Sauvignon (LujÃ¡n de Cuyo)

description: Smells like corn stalks and also of oxidation. The palate is wet but shapeless, and the flavors are waxy and jumbled. It's yet another pass-it-by, underperforming Mendoza Chardonnay.
title: Cinco Sentidos 2009 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: The nose offers earthy, medicinal notes on the light black-cherry fruit. Thin on the palate, it has a cough syrup-like taste. The tannins are soft, the acids low. Finishes short.
title: Barkan 1996 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Galil)

description: Rather dilute, it shows slight black-cherry and blackberry aromas and flavors. The overall impression is really little more than alcohol and faint body. Finishes very dry, with innocuous tannins.
title: Alfasi 1998 Reserve Merlot (Maule Valley)

description: Sometimes Franc can have a lovely, alluringly floral bouquet; other times it can be downright vegetal and display green-bean characteristics. Unfortunately, this is an example of the latter. The wine has nice weight and texture, so if you don't mind your veggies in liquid form this might be more to your liking.
title: Macari 1997 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Vanilla, butterscotch and some harsher oak-derived compounds dominate the modest citrus fruit that might have been wine before it was turned into oak juice. For wood lovers only.
title: Laurel Lake 1998 Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This is Langetwins's first vintage of Malbec from estate vineyards and it leaves a bit to be desired. Flat and a tad watery, it's a one-dimensional quaff.
title: LangeTwins 2010 Estate grown Malbec (Lodi)

description: Of all the Cavas made by Freixenet, this oddly sweet Spumante is the weakest. This is briny, pickled and candied on the nose, with hints of lychee and banana. Flavors of Sprite, cane sugar and banana finish with sulfur, honeydew and a faux kiwi note.
title: Freixenet NV Spumante Sparkling (Cava)
